intro: Helicteres glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Helicteres glabriuscula is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
